- Not Open or Free

- $7,500/year

title: Adam Curtis on the dangers of self-expression (2017)
dot:
digraph G{rankdir=LR; Art[label="Art
- Self-expression
- Not a substitute for political action
- Reflects societal mood
- Conformity of self-expression", shape=box];Individualism[label="Individualism
- Originates from the 60s-70s
- Self-expression as a response to political failure
- Capitalism sells self-expression", shape=box];Power[label="Power
- Importance of collective action
- Diminished perception of power
- Computers reveal group identities", shape=box];Freedom[label="Freedom
- Individual vs. collective freedom
- Historical examples of collective action
- Different definitions of freedom", shape=box];Myth[label="Myth
- Disenchantment of modern age
- Desire for enchantment
- Need for new myths to explain complexities", shape=box];Art->Individualism[label="Critique of self-expression"];Individualism->Power[label="Self-expression feeds power structure"];Power->Freedom[label="Collective power vs. individualism"];Freedom->Myth[label="Need for new narratives"];Myth->Art[label="Art as a medium for re-enchantment"]; Art->Power[label="Art reflects power dynamics"];Individualism->Myth[label="Individualism can lead to disenchantment"];}
